DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Activity Surveillance Patient Discontinued Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an explanation, by decision of the participating patient, for permanent or temporary stop in systematic collection of health data on an ongoing basis stipulated in the action plan of a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to permanent or temporary stop, based on decision by the individual participant, in systematic collection of health data on an ongoing basis as stipulated in action plan for a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:The state of being active; any specific activity.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data on an ongoing basis.:A person who requires medical care.:Discontinued; stopped permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: The systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data on an ongoing basis.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a text field to justify or explain the administration or cessation of therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

DataElement.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
